job.title: System Engineer
job.description:
Location: Carmel, Indiana or Eagan, Minnesota


MISO is hiring a Systems Engineer to help mature our capabilities as we advance MISO’s Digital Strategy. Work with domain professionals and project teams to apply Systems Engineering logic and methodology. Be a part of crafting technology solutions that ensure the future systematic, reliable operations of the bulk electric power grid. This position will utilize modern systems engineering practices to develop and evolve our energy management platforms. We’re looking for someone who is curious, good at asking questions, and understanding engineering concepts!


As MISO’s Systems Engineer, you will:

  • Elicit, analyze, and handle/allocate system requirements by collaborating and working with the business throughout the product lifecycle
  • Lead system design, build/maintain functional models, and participate in design evaluation decisions and tradeoffs to transition the organization to an enterprise-wide portfolio management model
  • Partner with other professionals to build system engineering artifacts to support program/project management, vendor development, and business analysis
  • Collaborate across a broad and diverse set of partners (Enterprise Architecture, R&D, Product Teams, Software Development, Test, and Business teams) to help establish and improve a standard technical development model


To be successful in this role, we’re looking for the following:

  • Experience applying systems engineering practices and knowledge in modeling system requirements and designs using a variety of techniques (e.g. SysML) and associated tools (IBM Rational ReqPro/DOORs, Cameo, SparxEA, etc.)
  • Systems “thinker” and can approach problems logically, iteratively, incrementally at multiple layers of abstraction
  • An individual who is strong at documenting and maintaining functional specifications, concepts of operations, and operational definitions in support of engineering practices
  • Certified as a Systems Engineer by the International Council on Systems Engineering (INCOSE) preferred


Appropriate level will be determined based upon experience and knowledge


Transformative innovation is happening in the electric industry; from digitalizing homes and distributed resources, to renewable energy and an ever-changing grid. MISO manages the electricity superhighway in the Central U.S. and through use of groundbreaking research and advanced technology, our highly skilled employees ensure power flows reliably to 42 million Americans. Operating the electricity grid, running a robust energy market, planning for a bright future – it’s what our immensely hardworking and dedicated team does every day. 


At MISO, we are committed to the health and safety of our employees while maintaining a reliable bulk electric system. We are proud to offer #workfromhome options to our employees and MISO offers a comprehensive benefits package available on your first day of employment. #hiring
